text: Hello. Does anyone know how I can use workflows to delete a record in a Custom Object? We have some GDPR manners to manage, and we need to delete the records in the Custom Object.
Is this a one time thing, or does it need to be for future objects as well?

For future objects as well in the long term. But as of right now, we just have this one specific object were we would like to delete records.

The workaround is sending a notification to a user until the record is deleted, but we need to set up a system that ensures that the record is deleted. But by having a manual routine means that the proccess is not 100% watertight and errors will occur.

If you have operations Hub Professional: Custom Code block
If you don't and have some knowledge about API/Scripts: Write a third party delete script
If you don't have any of there, set up a workflow to flag this object with "Needs to be deleted" and add a filtered view on your custom object overview
And, of course, start with checking if you can figure out the GDPR issue in the source, as deletion afterwards isn't always GDPR compliant, HubSpot record history for example
